description: Application for Prior Approval Notification of proposed telecommunications operations for rooftop electronic communication base station to comprise of installation of six antennas (to a total height of 27.3m), 1no 300mm dish antenna, 1 no 600mm dish antenna and a GPS module (includes associated 3 no 4m antenna support poles) three radio cabinet enabling development works there to.
decision_conditions: Reason: Due to their siting, appearance additional mass and height, the proposed antennas, dishes and supporting structures would appear as dominant and discordant additions to the roof of the building within this location, and would therefore cause harm to the character and appearance of the host building, the New River Conservation Area and would cause harm to the setting of adjacent Grade II listed buildings and structures.  The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016), policies CS8 and CS9 of the Islington Core Strategy, policies DM2.1 and DM2.3 of the Development Management Policies 2013, guidance contained within the Urban Design Guide 2017 and the Conservation Area Design Guidelines 2002.
